title: Public transport for the A League Round 8 - Melbourne City v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 17 December 2022
articleContent:
Public transport for the A League Round 8 - Melbourne City v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 17 December 2022

Isuzu UTE A League Men’s is back at AAMI Park after the FIFA World Cup break. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the big Melbourne derby taking place with City taking on the Victory. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Saturday 17 December.

The event will begin at 7:45pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Lilydale – leaving 10:07pm from Platform 9
  • Belgrave – leaving at 9:57pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley - leaving at 9:55pm & 10:03pm from Platform 10
  • Caulfield – leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 4
  • Pakenham – leaving at p:55pm & 10:03pm from Platform 6
  • Sandringham - leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the A League Round 8 - Melbourne City v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 17 December 2022
